name: py-tables

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

description:
PyTables is a package for managing hierarchical datasets and designed to
efficiently and easily cope with extremely large amounts of data.

dependencies.name: bzip2
dependencies.description:
bzip2 is a freely available, patent free high-quality data compressor.
It typically compresses files to within 10% to 15% of the best available
techniques (the PPM family of statistical compressors), whilst being
around twice as fast at compression and six times faster at
decompression.

dependencies.name: c-blosc
dependencies.description: Blosc, an extremely fast, multi-threaded, meta-compressor library

dependencies.name: hdf5
dependencies.description:
HDF5 is a data model, library, and file format for storing and managing
data. It supports an unlimited variety of datatypes, and is designed for
flexible and efficient I/O and for high volume and complex data.

dependencies.name: py-blosc2
dependencies.description: Python wrapper for the C-Blosc2 library.

dependencies.name: py-cython
dependencies.description: The Cython compiler for writing C extensions for the Python language.

dependencies.name: py-numexpr
dependencies.description: Fast numerical expression evaluator for NumPy

dependencies.name: py-numpy
dependencies.description: Fundamental package for array computing in Python.

dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-py-cpuinfo
dependencies.description: Get CPU info with pure Python 2 & 3

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.name: zlib-api
dependencies.description:
A free, general-purpose, legally unencumbered lossless data-compression
library.

dependent_to.name: py-sfepy
dependent_to.description:
SfePy (https://sfepy.org/) is a software for solving systems of coupled
partial differential equations (PDEs) by the finite element method in
1D, 2D and 3D. It can be viewed both as black-box PDE solver, and as a
Python package which can be used for building custom applications.

dependent_to.name: py-neurotools
dependent_to.description:
A collection of tools for representing and anlyzing neuroscientific
data.

dependent_to.name: geopm
dependent_to.description:
GEOPM is an extensible power management framework targeting HPC. The
GEOPM package provides libgeopm, libgeopmpolicy and applications
geopmctl and geopmpolicy, as well as tools for postprocessing. GEOPM is
designed to be extended for new control algorithms and new hardware
power management features via its plugin infrastructure. Note: GEOPM
interfaces with hardware using Model Specific Registers (MSRs). For
propper usage make sure MSRs are made available directly or via the msr-
safe kernel module by your administrator.

dependent_to.name: py-carputils
dependent_to.description:
The carputils framework for running simulations with the openCARP
software.

dependent_to.name: parsec
dependent_to.description:
PaRSEC: the Parallel Runtime Scheduler and Execution Controller PaRSEC
is a runtime and a programming toolbox that support the design and
parallel execution of micro-tasks on distributed, heterogeneous systems.
